name: Naomi Ackie
bio: The British actress Naomi Ackie has played lead roles in Bong Joon Ho’s “Mickey 17,” the Whitney Houston biopic “I Wanna Dance With Somebody” and the Steve McQueen anthology “Small Axe,” among other films.

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Uzo Aduba
bio: After her Emmy-winning breakout in “Orange Is the New Black,” Uzo Aduba has appeared on the shows “In Treatment” and “Mrs. America.” She is currently starring in the series “The Residence.”

name: Casey Affleck
bio: Casey Affleck has starred in “Gone Baby Gone” and the “Ocean’s Eleven” series, among other movies. He won the best actor Oscar for his performance in “Manchester by the Sea.”

choices.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford

name: Pedro Almodóvar
bio: The Spanish filmmaker Pedro Almodóvar’s movies include “Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown,” “The Room Next Door” and “Talk to Her,” for which he won an Oscar for best screenplay.

name: Pamela Anderson
bio: The actress Pamela Anderson most recently earned acclaim for her lead performance in the drama “The Last Showgirl.”

name: Sean Baker
bio: Sean Baker won four Oscars, including best picture, for “Anora” this year. His credits include “The Florida Project” and “Tangerine.”

name: Elizabeth Banks
bio: Elizabeth Banks is a producer, director and actress who has starred in the “Hunger Games” franchise. She also directed the comedies “Cocaine Bear” and “Pitch Perfect 2," among others.

name: Michael Barker
bio: As co-president of Sony Pictures Classics, Michael Barker has helped shepherd the release of “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon,” “Whiplash” and “Call Me by Your Name,” among other films. The distributor’s movies have earned more than 40 Oscars.

name: Judy Becker
bio: Judy Becker is a production designer whose credits include “Brokeback Mountain,” “American Hustle” and “The Brutalist,” for which she received her second Oscar nomination.

name: Kate Berlant
bio: A comedian, actress and writer, Kate Berlant has appeared in “Once Upon a Time … in Hollywood” and “Don’t Worry Darling.”

name: Tom Bernard
bio: As co-president of Sony Pictures Classics, Tom Bernard has helped shepherd the release of “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon,” “Whiplash” and “Call Me by Your Name,” among other films. The distributor’s movies have earned more than 40 Oscars.

name: Mike Birbiglia
bio: Mike Birbiglia is a comedian, podcaster and actor whose credits include “Orange Is the New Black” and “Sleepwalk With Me.” His most recent special, “The Good Life,” is currently streaming on Netflix.

choices.title: Me and You and Everyone We Know

name: Jason Blum
bio: Jason Blum is the founder and chief executive of Blumhouse Productions, whose releases include “Get Out” and “Whiplash” as well as horror franchises like “The Purge” and “Insidious.”

name: Bong Joon Ho
bio: The South Korean filmmaker Bong Joon Ho’s award-winning films include “The Host,” “Snowpiercer” and “Memories of Murder.” His class-conscious thriller “Parasite” was the first non-English-language movie to take the Oscar for best picture.

name: Joel Kim Booster
bio: The actor and comedian Joel Kim Booster wrote and starred in “Fire Island.” He has also appeared on “Shrill,” “Industry” and “Search Party,” among other shows.

name: Danielle Brooks
bio: Danielle Brooks is a stage and screen actress who was nominated for an Oscar last year for her role in “The Color Purple.”

choices.title: Summer of Soul (...Or, When the Revolution Could Not Be Televised)

name: Mel Brooks
bio: Mel Brooks is a comedian and filmmaker whose credits in a seven-decade career include “The Producers,” “Blazing Saddles” and “Young Frankenstein.” He is set to star in the “Spaceballs” sequel.

name: Daniel Brühl
bio: The actor Daniel Brühl has appeared in “Inglourious Basterds,” “The Bourne Ultimatum” and “All Quiet on the Western Front,” among other films. He also played the title role in the limited series “The Alienist.”

name: Carter Burwell
bio: The composer Carter Burwell has earned Oscar nominations for “Carol,” “Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri” and “The Banshees of Inisherin.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Nuri Bilge Ceylan
bio: Nuri Bilge Ceylan is a Turkish filmmaker whose work includes “About Dry Grasses,” “Once Upon a Time in Anatolia” and the Palme d’Or winner “Winter Sleep.”

choices.title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

name: Jemaine Clement
bio: Jemaine Clement is one half of the musical and comedy duo Flight of the Conchords. His acting credits include “Moana,” “What We Do in the Shadows” and “
: The Way of Water.”

choices.title: A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night

name: Toni Collette
bio: The actress Toni Collette was nominated for an Oscar for “The Sixth Sense.” She is also known for “Hereditary” and “Little Miss Sunshine” as well as the series “United States of Tara.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Sofia Coppola
bio: An Oscar winner for best screenplay for her drama “Lost in Translation,” the filmmaker Sofia Coppola also directed “Marie Antoinette,” “The Virgin Suicides” and “Priscilla,” among other films.

name: Gia Coppola
bio: Gia Coppola is a writer and director whose credits include “Palo Alto” and “The Last Showgirl.”

name: Brian Cox
bio: Best known for his turn as the patriarch Logan Roy on the series “Succession,” the actor Brian Cox has also appeared in numerous stage productions and on the big screen in films like “Adaptation” and “Zodiac.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Julie Dash
bio: Julie Dash is a filmmaker who is often cited for the influence of her 1991 drama “Daughters of the Dust,” the first movie by a Black woman to receive a wide theatrical release in the United States.

name: Lena Dunham
bio: Lena Dunham created and starred in the series “Girls,” and has directed “Tiny Furniture” and other films. Her latest project, “Too Much,” begins streaming July 10 on Netflix.

choices.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
The Worst Person in the World

name: Ava DuVernay
bio: The writer-director Ava DuVernay’s work includes the feature “Selma” and the documentary “13TH,” both of which were Oscar-nominated, and the limited series “When They See Us.”

name: Robert Eggers
bio: The filmmaker Robert Eggers’s work includes “The Witch,” “The Northman” and, most recently, “Nosferatu.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Alden Ehrenreich
bio: The actor Alden Ehrenreich’s credits include “Oppenheimer,” “Hail, Caesar!” and “Fair Play.” He also starred as Han Solo in “
: A Star Wars Story.”

choices.title: The Worst Person in the World

name: Chiwetel Ejiofor
bio: The British stage and screen actor Chiwetel Ejiofor's credits includes the dramas “Children of Men,” “The Martian” and “12 Years a Slave,” for which he earned a best actor Oscar nomination.

choices.title: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

name: Sean Evans
bio: For 27 seasons, Sean Evans has served as the host and co-creator of the YouTube talk show “Hot Ones,” whose guests have included Margot Robbie, Viola Davis and Billie Eilish.

name: Jomo Fray
bio: Jomo Fray is a cinematographer whose credits include “Nickel Boys” and “All Dirt Roads Taste of Salt.”

choices.title: Hale County This Morning, This Evening

name: Cary Joji Fukunaga
bio: The filmmaker Cary Joji Fukunaga’s work includes “Jane Eyre,” “Beasts of No Nation” and “No Time to Die." He also directed the first season of the HBO series “True Detective.”

choices.title: Master and
: The Far Side of the World

name: Ziwe Fumudoh
bio: The writer, comedian and podcaster Ziwe Fumudoh was host of the variety series “Ziwe” on Showtime. She has also appeared on “The Studio” and “Succession,” among other shows.

name: Richard Gadd
bio: The actor and comedian Richard Gadd is best known as the creator and star of the series “Baby Reindeer,” for which he won three Emmys.

name: Brett Goldstein
bio: Brett Goldstein is an Emmy-winning actor, comic and writer known for his turn as Roy Kent on “Ted Lasso.” He is also a creator of the series “Shrinking.”

name: Reinaldo Marcus Green
bio: The filmmaker Reinaldo Marcus Green’s work includes “King Richard,” which was nominated for a best picture Oscar, and “Bob
: One Love.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Luca Guadagnino
bio: The filmmaker Luca Guadagnino’s body of work includes “Challengers,” “Call Me by Your Name” and, most recently, “Queer.” His “After the Hunt,” starring Julia Roberts, is set for release later this year.

name: Tony Hale
bio: The actor Tony Hale is known for his television work on “Arrested Development” and “Veep,” for which he won two Emmys. He recently voiced Fear in “Inside Out 2.”

choices.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

name: William Jackson Harper
bio: An Emmy and Tony nominee, the actor William Jackson Harper is known for roles on television (“The Good Place,” “The Underground Railroad”), in film (“Midsommar,” “Dark Waters”) and on Broadway (“Uncle Vanya,” “All the Way”).

choices.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

name: Naomie Harris
bio: The actress Naomie Harris is known for her work in “No Time to Die,” “28 Days Later” and “Moonlight,” for which she was nominated for an Oscar.

name: Sally Hawkins
bio: The actress Sally Hawkins has twice been nominated for an Academy Award — for “Blue Jasmine” and “The Shape of Water.” Her other screen appearances include “Happy-Go-Lucky,” “Wonka” and two “Paddington” films.

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

name: Amy Heckerling
bio: The director Amy Heckerling’s work includes “Fast Times at Ridgemont High,” “Clueless” and “Look Who’s Talking.”

choices.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood

name: Eugene Hernandez
bio: A founder of the online entertainment site IndieWire, Eugene Hernandez is director of the Sundance Film Festival.

name: Joe Hill
bio: The writer Joe Hill is known for novels, short stories and comic books that have often been adapted for the screen, including the horror movie “The Black Phone” and the series “Locke & Key.”

name: Joanna Hogg
bio: The director Joanna Hogg’s semiautobiographical films and frequent colloborations with Tilda Swinton include “The Souvenir” and “The Eternal Daughter.”

name: Bryce Dallas Howard
bio: Bryce Dallas Howard is known for her roles in “The Help” and the “Jurassic World” franchise. She has also directed documentaries, including “Dads” and “Pets.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Portrait of a Lady on Fire

name: Cord Jefferson
bio: Cord Jefferson won the Oscar for best adapted screenplay this year for “American Fiction,” which he also directed.

choices.title: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead

name: Barry Jenkins
bio: The director Barry Jenkins took home the Oscar for best adapted screenplay for his second feature, “Moonlight,” which also won best picture.

choices.title: Once Upon a Time in Anatolia

name: Darius Khondji
bio: Twice nominated for an Oscar, the cinematographer Darius Khondji is known for his work with directors like Bong Joon Ho, David Fincher and Wong Kar-wai.

choices.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

name: Stephen King
bio: Stephen King’s novels and short stories have been adapted numerous times for the screen, including “The Shawshank Redemption,” “Misery” and, most recently, “The Life of Chuck.”

name: Vicky Krieps
bio: The actress Vicky Krieps is known for her turn opposite Daniel Day-Lewis in “Phantom Thread”  and for the M. Night Shyamalan thriller “Old.” She can be seen next in the drama “Hot Milk.”

choices.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)

name: David Krumholtz
bio: The actor David Krumholtz has appeared in films including “Oppenheimer” and “Superbad,” as well as in numerous stage and television productions.

choices.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

name: Karyn Kusama
bio: The filmmaker Karyn Kusama is known for her feature debut, “Girlfight,” as well as “Jennifer’s Body” and “Destroyer.”

name: Kevin Kwan
bio: Kevin Kwan is a best-selling novelist whose fiction debut, “Crazy Rich Asians,” was adapted for the screen.

choices.title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

name: Nathan Lane
bio: A Tony and Emmy winner, the actor Nathan Lane is known for roles in “The Lion King,” “The Birdcage” and “Beau Is Afraid,” among other films.

name: Lee Chang-dong
bio: The South Korean filmmaker Lee Chang-dong’s best-known work includes “Peppermint Candy,” “Oasis” and “Burning,” which was named one of the 10 best movies of the year by The New York Times.

name: Malcolm D. Lee
bio: The director Malcolm D. Lee’s movies include “The Best Man,” “Girls Trip” and “Undercover Brother.”

name: Min Jin Lee
bio: The American writer Min Jin Lee's best-selling novels include "Free Food for Millionaires" and "Pachinko," the latter of which became a limited series.

name: Dennis Lehane
bio: Dennis Lehane is a novelist whose work has been adapted many times for the screen, including the films “Mystic River,” “Shutter Island” and “Gone Baby Gone.” He created the forthcoming series “Smoke.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Dolly de Leon
bio: The actress Dolly de Leon received numerous accolades for her performance in “Triangle of Sadness,” and can currently be seen in the anthology series “Nine Perfect Strangers.”

choices.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: John Lithgow
bio: The Oscar-nominated actor John Lithgow’s career spans more than five decades; his recent screen appearances include “Killers of the Flower Moon” and “Conclave.”

name: Simu Liu
bio: The actor Simu Liu starred in “Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings,” “Barbie”  and the series “Kim’s Convenience.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Mikey Madison
bio: Mikey Madison won the best actress Oscar for “Anora” this year. Her credits include “Once Upon a Time … in Hollywood” and the series “Better Things.”

choices.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire

name: Lesley Manville
bio: The actress Lesley Manville is known for “Vera Drake,” “Secrets & Lies” and “Phantom Thread,” for which she earned Oscar and BAFTA nominations for best supporting actress.

name: Brit Marling
bio: Brit Marling is an actress and screenwriter whose credits include “Sound of My Voice” and “Another Earth,” and the series “The OA” and “A Murder at the End of the World.”

choices.title: Hale County This Morning, This Evening
Portrait of a Lady on Fire

name: Rob Marshall
bio: A filmmaker and choreographer, Rob Marshall earned an Oscar nomination for best director for “Chicago.” His credits include “Into the Woods” and the live-action version of “The Little Mermaid.”

choices.title: All Quiet on the Western Front

name: Bill Mechanic
bio: Bill Mechanic was head of 20th Century Fox when it released “Titanic” and “Independence Day,” among other movies. As a producer, his credits include “Hacksaw Ridge” and “Coraline.”

name: Charles Melton
bio: After appearing on television in series like “Riverdale,” Charles Melton won several awards for his turn in the drama “May December.”

name: Stephen Merchant
bio: The British writer and comedian Stephen Merchant was a creator of  the original British version of “The Office.” His film appearances include turns in “Jojo Rabbit” and “Logan.”

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Arian Moayed
bio: Arian Moayed has appeared on television (“Succession”), on Broadway (“A Doll’s House”) and on film (“Spider-
: No Way Home”).

name: Julianne Moore
bio: Known for “Far From Heaven” and “Still Alice,” for which she won the best actress Oscar, Julianne Moore recently starred in the Pedro Almodóvar drama “The Room Next Door.”

name: Michael Moses
bio: As the chief marketing officer at Universal Pictures, Michael Moses has overseen campaigns for  “Oppenheimer,” “Wicked” and the “Despicable Me” franchise.

name: Cristian Mungiu
bio: The Romanian filmmaker Cristian Mungiu is known for “Beyond the Hills,” “Graduation” and the Palme d’Or-winning drama “4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days.”

name: James Murphy
bio: As the leader of LCD Soundsystem, the musician James Murphy has had his work featured in movies and television shows, and has composed scores for “Greenberg” and “While We're Young,” among other films.

name: Julianne Nicholson
bio: The actress Julianne Nicholson has appeared in “I, Tonya,” “
: Osage County” and “Blonde.” Her recent television work includes “Hacks” and “Mare of Easttown,” for which she won an Emmy.

name: Patton Oswalt
bio: Patton Oswalt is a comedian and actor whose credits include “Ratatouille” and “Young Adult” as well as the series “BoJack Horseman” and “The King of Queens.”

name: Amy Pascal
bio: The former chairwoman of Sony Pictures Entertainment, Amy Pascal has produced films including “Spider-
: Across the Spider-Verse,” “The Post” and “Little Women.”

name: Justin Peck
bio: The resident choreographer at New York City Ballet, Justin Peck is a Tony winner who has also worked on the films “West Side Story” and “Maestro.”

name: Christian Petzold
bio: The German filmmaker Christian Petzold has been widely recognized for his dramas, including “Barbara,” “Transit” and “Undine.”

choices.title: Once Upon a Time in Anatolia

name: Michael Philippou
bio: Alongside his twin brother, Danny, the YouTuber-turned-filmmaker Michael Philippou directed the horror hit “Talk to Me” and the current release “Bring Her Back,” starring Sally Hawkins.

name: Corneliu Porumboiu
bio: The Romanian filmmaker Corneliu Porumboiu has directed acclaimed features and documentaries,  including “12:08 East of Bucharest” and “Police, Adjective.”

name: Paula Poundstone
bio: Paula Poundstone is a comedian and author whose numerous credits include “Inside Out” and its sequel.

name: Gina Prince-Bythewood
bio: The director and screenwriter Gina Prince-Bythewood’s best-known films include “Love & Basketball,” “The Old Guard” and “The Woman King.” Her next movie, “Children of Blood and Bone,” is due in theaters in 2027.

name: Tom Quinn
bio: As chief executive of Neon, Tom Quinn has overseen the release of movies including “Parasite,” “Anora,” “Triangle of Sadness” and “Anatomy of a Fall.”

choices.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire

name: Mohammad Rasoulof
bio: The Iranian filmmaker Mohammad Rasoulof’s notable movies include “Manuscripts Don’t Burn,” “There Is No Evil” and “The Seed of the Sacred Fig.”

name: Halina Reijn
bio: An actress turned filmmaker, Halina Reijn most recently directed “Babygirl” and “Bodies Bodies Bodies.”

name: Simon Rich
bio: A novelist who has worked as a staff writer for both Pixar and “Saturday Night Live,” Simon Rich also created two television shows, “Man Seeking Woman” and “Miracle Workers.”

choices.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood

name: Molly Ringwald
bio: Known for teen roles in films like “The Breakfast Club,” "Pretty in Pink" and “Sixteen Candles,” the actress Molly Ringwald most recently appeared in the limited series “
: Capote vs. the Swans.”

name: Phoebe Robinson
bio: Phoebe Robinson is a comedian, author and podcaster who has appeared on television shows including “Broad City,” “I Love Dick” and “Search Party.”

name: Eric Roth
bio: The writer Eric Roth won an Oscar for his screenplay for “Forrest Gump.” His best-known work includes “A Star Is Born,” “Dune” and “Killers of the Flower Moon.”

name: Geoffrey Rush
bio: The actor Geoffrey Rush won the Oscar for best actor for "Shine." He is also a Tony and Emmy winner.

name: Taylor Russell
bio: The actress Taylor Russell has starred in “Bones and All” opposite Timothée Chalamet, and the series “Lost in Space.”

name: Benny Safdie
bio: Benny Safdie is an actor and filmmaker whose collaborations with his brother, Josh, include  “Uncut Gems” and “Good Time.” His solo directing debut, “Smashing Machine,” is set for later this year.

name: Josh Safdie
bio: Josh Safdie is a filmmaker whose credits with his brother, Benny, include “Uncut Gems” and “Good Time.” His next movie, the Timothée Chalamet ping-pong drama “Marty Supreme,” is set for December.

name: Will Sharpe
bio: The actor Will Sharpe’s work includes “A Real Pain” and an Emmy-nominated turn in “The White Lotus.” He can next be seen in the Lena Dunham-created Netflix series “Too Much.”

name: Ali Siddiq
bio: Ali Siddiq is a comedian whose most recent streaming specials include “My Two Sons” and “Rugged.”

name: Gabourey Sidibe
bio: The actress Gabourey Sidibe earned an Oscar nomination for best actress for “Precious” and has since appeared in “Tower Heist” and “Antebellum,” among other films.

name: Curtis Sittenfeld
bio: Curtis Sittenfeld is the author of the best-selling novels “Prep,” “American Wife” and “Rodham,” among others. Her story collection, “Show Don’t Tell,” was published earlier this year.

choices.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

name: Justice Smith
bio: The actor Justice Smith starred in the drama “I Saw the TV Glow.” His credits include “Pokémon Detective Pikachu” and “Dungeons &
: Honor Among Thieves.”

name: Celine Song
bio: The director and screenwriter Celine Song’s debut, “Past Lives,” received Oscar nominations for best picture and best screenplay. Her follow-up, the romance “Materialists,” is in theaters now.

name: Cailee Spaeny
bio: The actress Cailee Spaeny has starred in “
: Romulus,” “Priscilla” and “Civil War.”

choices.title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed

name: Nicholas Sparks
bio: Nicholas Sparks’s best-selling novels have been adapted for the screen many times. They include “The Notebook,” “A Walk to Remember” and "Message in a Bottle.”

name: June Squibb
bio: The actress June Squibb was nominated for a best supporting actress Oscar for her turn in Alexander Payne’s dramedy “Nebraska.” She next stars in “Eleanor the Great,” directed by Scarlett Johansson.

choices.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood

name: Tramell Tillman
bio: An actor known for the series “Severance,” Tramell Tillman most recently appeared onscreen in “
: Impossible – The Final Reckoning.”

name: Joachim Trier
bio: The filmmaker Joachim Trier is best known for his Oslo
: “Reprise,” Oslo, August 31st” and “The Worst Person in the World,” the last of which was nominated for two Oscars.

name: Jodie Turner-Smith
bio: The actress Jodie Turner-Smith’s work includes the crime drama “Queen & Slim” and the title role in the series “Anne Boleyn.”

name: John Turturro
bio: The actor John Turturro is known for performances in “Do the Right Thing,” “The Big Lebowski” and, most recently, the series “Severance,” for which he was nominated for an Emmy.

name: Lulu Wang
bio: Lulu Wang is a filmmaker whose work includes “The Farewell” and “Posthumous.” She recently directed and produced the limited series “Expats,” starring Nicole Kidman.

name: John Waters
bio: John Waters is an author and filmmaker whose movies include “Hairspray,” “Serial Mom” and “Pink Flamingos.”

choices.title: : The Childhood of Joan of Arc

name: Samara Weaving
bio: The actress Samara Weaving’s screen roles include “Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri,” “Ready or Not” and “Babylon.”

name: Matthew Weiner
bio: Matthew Weiner has won nine Emmys for his work as the creator of “Mad Men” and as a writer and executive producer of “The Sopranos.”

choices.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire

name: Shea Whigham
bio: Shea Whigham is an actor who appears frequently in movies (“Joker,” “The Wolf of Wall Street”) and on television (“Fargo,” “Boardwalk Empire”). He can next be seen in the car-racing drama “F1.”

name: Lana Wilson
bio: Lana Wilson’s work as a documentary filmmaker includes “After Tiller,” the Taylor Swift portrait “Miss Americana” and “Pretty
: Brooke Shields.”

choices.title: Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

name: Alex Winter
bio: Known for his screen roles in “Bill & Ted’s Excellent Adventure” and “The Lost Boys,” Alex Winter is also a documentary filmmaker. He will be seen on Broadway this fall opposite Keanu Reeves in “Waiting for Godot.”

choices.title: Bad Luck Banging or Loony Porn

name: Edgar Wright
bio: A filmmaker whose movies include “Shaun of the Dead” and “Scott Pilgrim vs. the World,” Edgar Wright is set to release the dystopian drama “The Running Man” later this year.

choices.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
The Worst Person in the World

name: Joe Wright
bio: The filmmaker Joe Wright’s work includes “Atonement,” “Darkest Hour” and “Pride & Prejudice,” starring Keira Knightley.

choices.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood

name: Rachel Zegler
bio: The actress Rachel Zegler has starred in “West Side Story,” “Snow White” and “The Hunger
: The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes.”

choices.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
